result.execSummary:
The defendant Brent A Schaefer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Invade Privacy - Enter Private Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge

--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Follow Through with any AODA recommended treatment, per Agent
--Meet with psychiatrist for psychosexual and/or psychological assessment, to be determined by psychiatrist and follow through with all treatment recommendations
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No contact with Joanne Sandvik or VKZ (dob 3/25/1950)
--No presence at N1049 or N1089 Vinnie Ha Ha Road properties (to include lawn and driveway areas)
--Comply with GPS monitoring, including exclusion zones, per Agent
--Curfew - not to be out of his residence after 9:00 pm  - 5:00 am seven days a week, unless expressly approved by Agent

**If revoked, conditions of probation will become conditions of extended supervision

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:06 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Brent A Schaefer in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann on behalf of Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock submits victim impact statement; Sentencing Arguments by Counsel

The Court IMPOSES AND STAYS 1 AND HALF YEARS PRISON, WITH 1 YEAR INITIAL CONFINEMENT AND 6 MONTHS EXTENDED SUPERVISION and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--Follow Through with any AODA recommended treatment, per Agent
--Meet with psychiatrist for psychosexual and/or psychological assessment, to be determined by psychiatrist and follow through with all treatment recommendations
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $243
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--No contact with Joanne Sandvik or VKZ (dob 3/25/1950)
--No presence at N1049 or N1089 Vinnie Ha Ha Road properties (to include lawn and driveway areas)
--Comply with GPS monitoring, including exclusion zones, per Agent
--Curfew - not to be out of his residence after 9:00 pm  - 5:00 am seven days a week, unless expressly approved by Agent

**If revoked, conditions of probation will become conditions of extended supervision
**If revoked, Court finds that Mr. Schaefer is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 2:16 pm
Sentencing hearing at 09-10-2015 02:00 pm
Criminal Case Settlement
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 9:00 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for plea/sentencing)
Defendant Brent A Schaefer in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Requests matter be set again for plea/sentencing, presents basis including that part of agreement requires AODA assessment prior to sentencing.
Court discusses hearing plea today and setting out sentencing
DA Happ: No preference on how to proceed, presents concerns about lack of having assessment completed
Court/Counsel discuss scheduling: Upon questioning of Atty De La Rosa & no objection to State, Court indicates that It will set sentencing 60 - 75 days out so assessment can be accomplished, but plea will be taken today so case can keep moving forward
Recess: 9:04 am Reconvene: 9:27 am - for Atty De La Rosa to complete plea paperwork
Atty De La Rosa submits plea paperwork; Court reviews criminal case settlement with Mr. Schaefer

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
Court finds that Mr. Schaefer has been properly charged as/convicted as a repeater
Court reminds Mr. Schaefer that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect as case is pending
Recess: 9:35 am 

NEXT:  (1) Schedule Sentencing Hearing 9/10/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 10:22 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV]
Defendant Brent A Schaefer in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa: Is requirement of treatment before offer, requests matter be set for plea/sentencing in approx. 45 days 
ADA Teuber: Agreed
Court confirms address on file is accurate
Recess: 10:24 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 6/30/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices
Status conference on May 15, 2015 at 10:00 am.
State's with Cover Letter
Status conference on May 8, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 22, 2015 at 10:20 am.
Scheduling Notice

Defendant Brent A Schaefer in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court continues  bond as previously set
Recess: 10:42 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 4/22/15 at 10:20 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 5/8/15 at 2:00 pm - Send notices

Adjourned initial appearance on March 17, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

case called at 2:57pm. [MK]
Defendant Brent A Schaefer appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

After the Court verifies with Mr. Schaefer that he can see and hear the proceedings, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Mr. Schaefer verifies that the date of birth and the residential address on the Criminal Complaint is correct. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.
Mr. Schaefer indicates that he heard the Court's recitation of information regarding right to counsel and that constructive waiver of counsel warnings were given.  Mr. Schaefer indicates that he thought he would have Public Defender counsel appearing with him today. He will request, through jail staff, to meet with PD staff in the Jail. 

The Court requires a $1,000  signature bond, with conditions:
--no presence at N1084 Vinnie Ha Ha Road in the Town of Koshkonong
--no contact JoAnn Sandvick
--to maintain absolute sobriety 
recess 3:04pm. 


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 3/17/15 at 2:00pm.
